question: In what year of Cyrus’ reign was the decree made allowing the Jews to return to Jerusalem (Ezra 1:1)?
Who was the king who made a decree to allow the Jews to return to Jerusalem (Ezra 1:1)?
Cyrus was king of what empire (Ezra 1:1)?
The proclamation made by Cyrus allowing the Jews to return to Jerusalem was in fulfillment of the word of the Lord spoken by which prophet (Ezra 1:1)?
What or who moved the heart of the Cyrus, king of Persia (Ezra 1:1)?
What did Cyrus say the Lord had appointed him to do (Ezra 1:1)?
How did Cyrus in his proclamation identify the Lord (Ezra 1:2)?
choice: As the Rider of the Clouds
As the creator of heaven and earth

question: How did Cyrus in his proclamation identify the Lord (Ezra 1:3)?
choice: As the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob
As the God who is in Jerusalem
As he who dwells between the cherubim

question: What did Cyrus credit God with giving him (Ezra 1:2)?
choice: All power in heaven and on earth
All the kingdoms of the earth

question: Who was to supply the returning Jews with gold to rebuild the temple (Ezra 1:4)?
choice: The family of Haman the Agagite

question: What king of offering was to be given to support the rebuilding of the temple by the survivors (Ezra 1:4)?
Cyrus in his proclamation listed all of the following as to be provided to the returning Jews EXCEPT (Ezra 1:4)
All of the following were specifically listed as having had their hearts moved by the Lord to rebuild the temple EXCEPT (Ezra 1:5)
Who provided the Jews with gold and silver to rebuild the temple (Ezra 1:6)?
What did Cyrus personally give to the returning Jews for the rebuilding of the temple in Jerusalem (Ezra 1:7)?
choice: The tribute that Zedekiah had paid to Nebuchadnezzar
The articles which Nebuchadnezzar had carried away from the temple
The cedars of Lebanon with which to rebuild the temple in Jerusalem
The gold and silver of the temple treasury which Nebuchadnezzar had stolen

question: Where had Nebuchadnezzar placed the articles from the temple of the Lord which he had confiscated (Ezra 1:7)?
choice: In the temple of his god

question: Who was Mithredath under Cyrus (Ezra 1:8)?
choice: His secretary and recorder of the royal annals

question: To whom did Cyrus give the temple articles he wanted returned to Jerusalem (Ezra 1:8)?
Cyrus returned (specifically listed) all of the following articles to the temple in Jerusalem EXCEPT
What was the total number of articles Cyrus returned to Sheshbazzar the prince of Judah (Ezra 1:11)?
Who were the exiles taken into captivity by (Ezra 2:1)?
The company of returning exiles traveled with all of the following EXCEPT (Ezra 2:2)?
All of the following were descendants of Parosh who were returning EXCEPT (Ezra 2:3-20)
The returnees returned to all of the following towns EXCEPT (Ezra 2:21-35)
All of the following were priests among the returnees EXCEPT (Ezra 2:36-39)
The Levites who returned were the descendants of _______ (Ezra 2:40)
The singers of those who returned where descendants of ______ (Ezra 2:41)
In what role or duty did the descendants of Shallum and Talmon formerly function (Ezra 2:42f)?
In what role or duty did the descendants of Ziha, Keros and Lebanah formerly function (Ezra 2:43-54)?
In what role or duty did the descendants of Sotai, Peruda, and Darkon formerly function (Ezra 2:55-57)?
Ezra lists all of the following formerly functioning groups among the returnees EXCEPT (Ezra 2:3-58)
What could some who came up from Tel Melah and Tel Harsha not do (Ezra 2:59)?
choice: Show the towns they were from
Show that their families were descended from Israel
Show what tribe they had come from
Show the vocation that their family had before the exile

question: The man Barzillai was named after was a ______ (Ezra 2:61)?
Why were some excluded from the priesthood as unclean (Ezra 2:62)?
choice: Because they had served as priests of Marduk in Babylon
Because they had intermarried with the Midianites
Because they could not find their family records

question: What were those “priests” who could not find their family records not allowed to do by the order of the governor (Ezra 2:63)?
choice: Not to eat the sacred food
Not to offer sacrifices to the Lord
Not to receive from tithes and offerings
Not to enter the Temple Mount

question: Who ordered those who had not family records not to eat the sacred food (Ezra 2:63)?
What did the governor say was needed to determine whether some could function as priests once again (Ezra 2:63)?
Who large was the company of returnees (Ezra 2:64)?
How many menservants and maidservants did the returnees bring back (Ezra 2:64)?
All of the following were listed as animals the returnees brought with them EXCEPT (Ezra 2:66)
All of the following were given by the heads of the families of the returnees EXCEPT (Ezra 2:69)
All of the following settled in their own towns EXCEPT (Ezra 2:70)?
What did the people who returned do in the seventh month (Ezra 3:1)?
choice: They came to build the walls of Jerusalem
They sent messengers back to Cyrus reporting on their progress
They built the Eastern Gate of the city of Jerusalem

question: In what month did the returnees assemble in Jerusalem as one person (Ezra 3:1)?
What did Jeshua and Zerubbabel do in accordance with the Law of Moses (Ezra 3:2)?
choice: They built an altar and began to sacrifice on it
They built the north wall of the city of Jerusalem
They read the Law of Moses to the people
They used the blood of a red heifer to cleanse the temple area

question: What two people rebuilt the altar of God (Ezra 3:2)?
Jeshua was the son of __________ (Ezra 3:2)
Zerubbabel was the son of _________ (Ezra 3:2)
In accordance with what did Jeshua and Zerubbabel rebuilt the altar of the Lord (Ezra 3:2)?
choice: The words of Isaiah the prophet
The plans of Hezekiah king of Judah

question: When were the burnt offering sacrifices made on the rebuilt altar ( Ezra 3:3)?
What type of offerings were first offered on the rebuilt altar (Ezra 3:3)?
What feast was celebrated with offerings right after they rebuilt the altar (Ezra 3:4)?
Why were the people afraid to rebuilt the altar of the Lord at Jerusalem (Ezra 3:3)?
choice: Because they did not have enough gold for the altar
Because a high priest had not arisen to offer the sacrifice
Cyrus had not told them to
Because of the peoples around them

question: What offerings were brought to the Lord after the altar was rebuilt (Ezra 3:5)?
Though they offered sacrifices on the first day of the seventh month what was noted with regret (Ezra 3:6)?
choice: The foundation of the Lord’s temple had not be laid
The walls of Jerusalem still lay in ruins
The walls of the palace of the governor had not been completed
The people did not know the Law of Moses

question: What had Cyrus king of Persia authorized be brought to Jerusalem (Ezra 3:7)?
To what Israelite city were the cedar logs brought before they were delivered to Jerusalem (Ezra 3:7)?
Who was given food and drink and oil to pay for the cedars of Lebanon (Ezra 3:7)?
choice: The people of Tyre and Sidon

question: Who authorized the purchase of the cedars from Lebanon (Ezra 3:7)?
How were the cedar logs of Lebanon transported down to Joppa (Ezra 3:7)?
What did Jeshua and Zerubbabel start building in the second month of the second year after the return (Ezra 3:8)?
choice: Began to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem
Laid the foundation of the gate of Jerusalem
Laid the foundation of the temple of the Lord
Rebuilt the palace of the governor

question: Who supervised the building of the house of the Lord (Ezra 3:8)?
choice: The Persian governors appointed by Cyrus
The Levites over 20 years of age

question: All of the following were individuals specifically mentioned as overseeing the work on rebuilding the house of God EXCEPT (Ezra 3:9)
When the temple foundation was laid who did the cymbals ( Ezra 3:10)?
When did the people take their places to praise the Lord (Ezra 3:10)?
choice: When the found of the temple of the Lord was laid
When they laid the foundation of the gate of the city of Jerusalem
When the priests marched around the city
When the altar of the Lord was built

question: How did the people prepare to praise the Lord when the foundation of the temple was laid (Ezra 3:10)?
choice: As prescribed in the Law of Moses
As prescribed by David king of Israel
As prescribed by the sons of Aaron
As prescribed by Josiah king of Judah

question: What was the praise that was sung when the foundation of the temple was laid (Ezra 3:11)?
choice: O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth
Sing praise to the Lord, praise his holy name
He is good; his love to Israel endures forever
Praise him all you people for our God is great

question: How did the people respond to the foundation of the temple being laid (Ezra 3:11)?
choice: They gave a shout of praise
They were silent before the Lord
They recited the Law of the Moses
They raised their hands to the heavens

question: What was the response to the laying of the foundation by the older priests and Levites (Ezra 3:12)?
Who wept when the foundation of the Lord’s temple was laid (Ezra 3:12)?
choice: The older priests and Levites who had seen the former temple
Those who had recently come back from Babylon
The younger heads of the family as they saw their families worshipping
Jeshua and Zerubbabel who had laid the foundation

question: When the temple foundation was laid what could not be distinguished (Ezra 3:13)?
choice: The shouts of praise from the shouts of joy
The weeping from the shouts of joy

question: The enemies were portrayed as against Judah and what other tribe (Ezra 4:1)?
What did the enemies hear that the exiles were doing (Ezra 4:1)?
choice: Building a temple for the Lord
Digging the wells and allowing their flocks to multiply

question: Who did the enemies of Judah and Benjamin come to offer help (Ezra 4:2)?
To whom did the enemies of Judah and Benjamin say they had been sacrificing (Ezra 4:2)?
The enemies of Judah said they were sacrificing to their God since the time of what king (Ezra 4:2)?
Who had brought the enemies of Judah and Benjamin to the land (Ezra 4:2)?
What was Zerubbabel’s and Jeshua’s response to the offer of help from their enemies to rebuild the temple (Ezra 4:3)?
choice: The Jews alone will build it for the Lord
The Jews would only accept gifts of gold and silver
They should send their skilled craftsmen to help
They could be woodcutters and water bearers

question: After the enemies’ offer was refused what did they set out to do (Ezra 4:4)?
choice: Attack the servants of the Lord

question: Who did the enemies hire to oppose the work of building the temple (Ezra 4:5)?
How long did the counselors seek to frustrate the plans of Zerubbabel (Ezra 4:5)? From the reign of Cyrus to ________
In the beginning of whose reign did Zerubbabel’s enemies lodge an accusation against the people of Judah and Jerusalem (Ezra 4:6)?
In what language was the letter written to Artaxerxes king of Persia (Ezra 4:7)?
To whom did Tabeel and the rest of his associates write a letter against Judah (Ezra 4:7)?
All of the following wrote a letter opposing Judah to Artaxerxes king of Persia EXCEPT (Ezra 4:7)
Who was the commanding officer who wrote the letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes (Ezra 4:8)?
Who was the secretary who wrote the letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes (Ezra 4:8)?
Shimshai’s letter said who had deported them to Samaria (Ezra 4:9)?
Shimshai’s letter said they had be deported from Susa and elsewhere and resettled in what city in Israel (Ezra 4:10)?
Shimshai said that they had been deported from all of the following cities into Samaria EXCEPT (Ezra 4:9)
How did Shimshai identify himself in his letter to Artaxerxes (Ezra 4:11)?
What did Rehum and Shimshai accuse the Jews of doing to Artaxerxes (Ezra 4:12)?
choice: Restoring the walls and repairing the foundations
Rebuilding the temple and restoring the gates of the city
Building an altar and serving gods other than those of the Persians
Killing their enemies without a cause

question: How did Rehum and Shimshai label the city of Jerusalem in their letter to Artaxerxes (Ezra 4:12)?
What did Rehum and Shimshai tell Artaxerxes would happen if Jerusalem was allowed to be rebuilt (Ezra 4:13)?
choice: They would demand freedom for Jerusalem
They would go to war once again
They would kill Rehum and Shimshai the allies of Artaxerxes

question: Why did Rehum and Shimshai allege that they were sending this letter (Ezra 4:14)?
choice: Because their land had been taken by the Jews
Because the king was being dishonored
Because they feared for their lives
Because Zerubbabel was leading a revolt against the king

question: What did Rehum call for Artaxerxes to do in his letter (Ezra 4:15)?
choice: Search the archives of his predecessors
Double the taxes on those living in Judah and Jerusalem

question: What did Rehum warn Artaxerxes would happen if the walls of Jerusalem were restored (Ezra 4:16)?
choice: Artaxerxes would have nothing left in Trans-Euphrates
Artaxerxes would lose his loyal friends
Artaxerxes would have to go to war again to take Jerusalem
Rehum, Artaxerxes’ loyal servant would be killed

question: Where did Rehum and Shimshai live (Ezra 4:17)?
What did Artaxerxes tell Rehum and Shimshai was done with their letter (Ezra 4:18)?
choice: It was burned in the fire
It was recorded in the annals of the king

question: Artaxerxes told Rehum and Shimshai that Jerusalem was a place of ______ (Ezra 4:19)?
What did Artaxerxes find out about the former kings of Israel (Ezra 4:20)?
choice: They did not pay their taxes
They slaughtered many in the Valley of Jezreel
They ruled over the whole of Trans-Euphrates
They came out of Egypt and had defeated Pharaoh

question: What did Artaxerxes order (Ezra 4:21)?
choice: That the work of rebuilding the city stop
That the Jews pay their tribute immediately
That Rehum and Shimshai be given rule over Jerusalem

question: Whose letter did Rehum and Shimshai use to stop the work in Jerusalem (Ezra 4:23)?
Until what time was the work on the temple halted as a result of Artaxerxes’ command (Ezra 4:24)?
choice: Until the third year of Cyrus
Until the first year of Alexander
Until the second year of Darius
Until the fifth year of Xerxes

question: What work was stopped until the second year of Darius as a result of Rehum’s letter to Artaxerxes (Ezra 4:24)?
choice: Work on the house of God
Work on the walls of Jerusalem
Work on the gates of Jerusalem
Work on laying the foundations of the temple

question: Who was a descendant of Iddo (Ezra 5:1)?
Who prophesied to the Jews in the post-exilic times of Zerubbabel (Ezra 5:1)?
Who helped Zerubbabel and Jeshua rebuild the temple (Ezra 5:2)?
Who did the prophets help build the temple (Ezra 5:2)?
Who was the governor of Trans-Euphrates in the days of Darius (Ezra 5:3)?
What did Tattenai and Shethar-Bozenai ask Zerubbabel (Ezra 5:4f)?
choice: Who authorized you to rebuild this temple?
Why are you rebuilding this temple?
Why are you rebuilding this rebellious city?
Who is paying for the rebuilding of this wall?

question: What did the narrator conclude about the elders of the Jews not being stopped until a report could go to Darius (Ezra 5:5)?
choice: They were keeping the covenant of their God
The eye of their God was watching over them
The forces of evil could not stop them
God gave them favor in the eyes of Darius

question: The Jews did not have to stop the rebuilding until what events transpired (Ezra 5:5)?
choice: Until the next Passover was completed
Until they received the cedars from Lebanon
Until they received a written reply from Darius

question: To whom did Tattenai the governor of Trans-Euphrates send a report (Ezra 5:6)?
How did Tattenai identify the Israel’s God to Darius in his report (Ezra 5:8)?
choice: The God of heaven and earth
The God of the Jews in Jerusalem

question: What besides the large stones did Tattenai comment that the temple was being built of (Ezra 5:8)?
What two things did Tattenai comment that the temple was being built of to Darius (Ezra 5:8)?
choice: Large bronze pillars and cut stone

question: What did Tattenai tell Darius he had asked the Jews in his report (Ezra 5:10)?
choice: What was need for the temple
When the temple would be completed
The names of the leaders doing the rebuilding

question: How did the Jews responding to Tattenai’s questions identify God (Ezra 5:11)?
How did the Jews in their report through Tattenai identify the king who originally built the first temple (Ezra 5:11)?
In the report of Tattenai to Darius to whom did the Jews acknowledge had destroyed the first temple (Ezra 5:12)?
Nebuchadnezzar was identified in the report to Darius as being from what group of people (Ezra 5:12)?
Besides destroying the first temple what did the Jewish leaders report that Nebuchadnezzar had done (Ezra 5:12)?
choice: Praised the God of heaven and earth

question: Why were the Jews handed over to Nebuchadnezzar and taken to Babylon according to the Jewish report to Darius (Ezra 5:12)?
choice: Because they had done evil in the sight of the Lord
Because their fathers had angered the God of heaven
Because they had worshipped idols made by human hands
Because the Lord had taken no pleasure in their forefathers

question: In the Jews report to Darius who did they credit with ordering the temple to be rebuilt (Ezra 5:13)?
What did Cyrus remove from Babylon and send back to Jerusalem (Ezra 5:14)?
choice: The sons of David and the prophets and priests of Israel
The gold and silver articles of the house of God taken by Nebuchadnezzar
The trumpets and golden shields that Solomon had built for the temple
The bronze pillars and bronze sea that Nebuchadnezzar had taken

question: Who had taken the gold and silver items from the temple in Jerusalem (Ezra 5:14)?
Who whom did Cyrus give the temple items to be returned to Jerusalem (Ezra 5:14)?
Where had Nebuchadnezzar put the items from the temple in Jerusalem (Ezra 5:14)?
choice: In the royal palace treasury in Babylon
In the storage city of Susa
He had them displayed in the gate of the city of Babylon

question: What was Sheshbazzar commissioned to do by Cyrus (Ezra 5:15)?
choice: Put down the rebellion in the land of Judea
Rebuild the house of God and deposit the temple articles there
Rebuild the walls of Jerusalem and restore its people
Guarantee the tribute from the land of Judea and put down rebellion there

question: Who did Cyrus commission to rebuild the house of God and deposit the temple articles (Ezra 5:15)?
Who laid the foundations of the temple in Jerusalem in the days of Zerubbabel (Ezra 5:16)?
What did the Jews request of king Darius (Ezra 5:17)?
choice: Protection against their enemies who were trying to stop their building
Search the royal archives for the decree of Cyrus
Return the temple articles of gold and silver from Babylon
Allow them to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem

question: Where were the archives that Darius ordered searched kept (Ezra 6:1)?
choice: In the royal palace of Susa
In the residence of Shimshai the secretary

question: Who ordered that the archives stored in the treasury of Babylon be searched (Ezra 6:1)?
In what town was the decree of Cyrus found and reported back to Darius (Ezra 6:2)?
In what year of Cyrus’ reign did he issue a decree concerning Jerusalem (Ezra 6:3)?
The Cyrus decree sites that the temple should be rebuilt in order to do what (Ezra 6:4)?
choice: To honor the name of the God of Israel
As a place to present sacrifices
So that the Israelites may have a home
So that the law may go forth from Zion

question: What size did the Cyrus decree specify for the temple foundation to be (Ezra 6:4)?
How many courses did Cyrus specify large stones for the foundation of the temple (Ezra 6:4)?
What did Cyrus order be returned to the temple in Jerusalem (Ezra 6:5)?
choice: The silver and gold articles Nebuchadnezzar had taken to Babylon
The bronze pillars and bronze sea be restored in front of the temple
The priests vestments along with the Urim and Thummim

question: Who had taken the temple articles of gold and silver to Babylon (Ezra 6:5)?
What did Darius tell Tattenai and Shethar-Bozenai to do after finding the decree of Cyrus (Ezra 6:6)?
choice: Help the Jews rebuild the temple
Transport the cedars of Lebanon from Joppa up to Jerusalem
Guard and protect the Jews as they rebuild the temple
Do not interfere with the work and stay away from there

question: Who was told to stay away and not to interfere with the Jewish rebuilding of the temple (Ezra 6:6)?
Darius ordered that who should be paid from the royal treasury in order to rebuild the temple in Jerusalem (Ezra 6:8)?
Darius ordered all of the following be provided to the elders of the Jews in their rebuilding of the temple EXCEPT (Ezra 6:8ff)
choice: Young bulls, rams and lambs be provided for burnt offerings
Wheat, salt, wine and oil be given to the priests
Purple vestments and royal wreaths be given to the high priest

question: Darius told Tattenai all of the following should be provided for sacrifices at Jerusalem EXCEPT (Ezra 6:9)
Darius told Tattenai all of the following should be provided for the priests at Jerusalem EXCEPT (Ezra 6:9)
What did Darius expect in return for supplying the expenses of those building the temple at Jerusalem (Ezra 6:10)?
choice: They would offer sacrifices pleasing to the God of heaven
They would remain loyal to Darius all the days of his reign
They would not rebel against the rule of the Persians
They would defend Darius from attack from Aram

question: What did Darius expect in return for supplying the expenses of those building the temple at Jerusalem (Ezra 6:10)?
choice: They would offer prayers for the well-being of the king and his sons
They would remain loyal to Darius all the days of his reign
They would not rebel against the rule of the Persians
They would defend Darius from attack from Aram

question: Who did Darius order would be impaled (Ezra 6:11)?
choice: Anyone who stole the supplies provided to the Jews at Jerusalem
Anyone who refused to sacrifice to the God at Jerusalem

question: What would happen to the one who changed Darius’ decree (Ezra 6:11)?
choice: They would be blinded and brought to Susa to face judgment
They would be impaled on a beam pulled from their own home
They would be stoned to death
They and their family would be burned to death

question: What would happen to the one who changed Darius’ decree (Ezra 6:11)?
choice: They would be put in chains and brought to Susa
They would be enslaved and made to help build the temple
They would serve the Jews as woodcutters and water bearers
Their house would be made a pile of rubble

question: How did Darius describe God’s relationship to Jerusalem (Ezra 6:12)?
choice: God’s law would go out from Jerusalem
God had caused his Name to dwell there
God had chosen Zion for his dwelling

question: Who carried out Darius’ decree (Ezra 6:13)?
Who was a descendant of Iddo (Ezra 6:14)?
Under whose preaching did the people build and prosper (Ezra 6:14)?
When the temple was completed it was acknowledged to be under the decrees of all of the following kings of Persia EXCEPT (Ezra 6:14)?
When was the temple completed (Ezra 6:15)?
choice: In the fourth year of Artaxerxes
In the tenth year of Artaxerxes
In the first year of Darius
In the sixth year of Darius

question: When was the temple completed (Ezra 6:15)?
choice: In the third day of the month of Adar
In the sixth day of the month of Nisan
In the twelfth day of the month of Sivan
In the first day of the month of Evan

question: At the dedication of the temple what were twelve male goats offered up for (Ezra 6:17)?
choice: Each of the governors over the returnees
Each of the tribes of Israel
Each of the months it took to complete the temple
In honor of the twelve delegates from Darius

question: All of the following were offered up when they dedicated the temple EXCEPT (Ezra 6:17)?
How were the priests installed at the dedication of the temple (Ezra 6:18)?
According to what were the Levites installed when the temple was dedicated (Ezra 6:18)?
choice: According to the directions of Zerubbabel
According to what was recorded in the prophecy of Iddo the Seer
According to what was written in the Book of Moses
According to the directions of Darius the king and Tattenai the governor

question: What did the exiles celebrate on the fourteenth day of the first month (Ezra 6:19)?
Who slaughtered the Passover lamb for the exiles (Ezra 6:20)?
From what unclean practices did those who partook of the Passover separate themselves (Ezra 6:21)?
choice: The practices of their Gentile neighbors
The eating of blood and fat
The Canaanites who were in the land

question: What did the Jews celebrate for seven days with joy (Ezra 6:22)?
The king of what territory was recognized and said to have changed his attitude in assisting them on the work of the house of God (Ezra 6:22)?
Who changed the king of Assyria’s heart (Ezra 6:22)?
Who was Ezra the son of (Ezra 7:1)?
Which of the following were NOT major figures in the priestly line that Ezra was a descendant of (Ezra 7:1f)?
Where did Ezra come from (Ezra 7:1)?
What was Ezra well versed in (Ezra 7:6)?
Besides being a priest what was Ezra by trade (Ezra 7:6)?
Why does the text say the king granted Ezra everything he asked for (Ezra 7:6)?
choice: Because he was a commander in the king’s army
Because he was a prophet of God most high
Because the hand of the Lord was on him
Because he had won the favor of Artaxerxes

question: All of the following came with Ezra in the seventh year of Artaxerxes EXCEPT (Ezra 7:7)
In what year did Ezra and the priests and Levites with him come to Jerusalem (Ezra 7:7)?
choice: In the fifth year of Darius
In the seventh year of Artaxerxes
In the third year of Xerxes
In the tenth year of Cyrus

question: In what month did Ezra arrive at Jerusalem (Ezra 7:8)?
In what month had Ezra left Babylon for Jerusalem (Ezra 7:9)?
To what had Ezra devoted himself (Ezra 7:10)?
choice: The rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem
The observance of the Law of the Lord
Helping the poor, fatherless and widows of Jerusalem

question: To what had Ezra devoted himself (Ezra 7:10)?
choice: The teaching the decrees and laws of the Lord to Israel
The rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem
Helping the poor, fatherless and widows of Jerusalem

question: Who gave Ezra a letter (Ezra 7:12)?
What did Artaxerxes letter grant Ezra (Ezra 7:13)?
choice: The temple items could be returned from Babylon
Any of the Israelites who wanted to return could go with Ezra
The children of those in Jerusalem could go with Ezra
The walls of Jerusalem could be built

question: Who actually sent Ezra to Jerusalem besides the king (Ezra 7:14)?
What did Artaxerxes and the advisers freely give to Ezra (Ezra 7:15)?
Artaxerxes instructed Ezra to buy with the gold and silver he provided all of the following EXCEPT (Ezra 7:17)?
Beyond the sacrifices what did Artaxerxes instruct Ezra to do with the rest of the money provided by the Persian king (Ezra 7:18)?
choice: Give a third of it to Rehum of Samaria
Build a gold statue of Artaxerxes
Use it to pay for the rebuilding of the walls

question: How did Artaxerxes repeatedly identify Ezra’s God in his letter to Ezra (Ezra 7:19)?
choice: Yahweh the maker of heaven and earth

question: Who did Artaxerxes order to give Ezra whatever he asked for (Ezra 7:21)?
choice: The keepers of the royal palace of Susa
The ambassador to region of Aram

question: Up to how many talents of silver did Artaxerxes give Ezra access to (Ezra 7:22)?
Artaxerxes gave Ezra access to all of the following at his discretion EXCEPT (Ezra 7:22)
What was the reason cited by Artaxerxes for providing Ezra with so many provisions (Ezra 7:23)?
choice: So that the wrath of the God of heaven be on the king and his sons
Because Ezra was a teacher of the Law of God
Because Ezra’s God was the only God in heaven and on earth
Because of all the evils the Jews had endured under the hands of the Babylonians

question: All of the following were given tax free status under the Persians by Artaxerxes EXCEPT (Ezra 7:24)
Who did Artaxerxes tell Ezra to appoint (Ezra 7:25)?
What did Artaxerxes say Ezra possessed from God (Ezra 7:25)?
What did Artaxerxes tell Ezra to teach (Ezra 7:25)?
choice: The laws of the Medes and Persians
The ways of righteousness and justice

question: Artaxerxes said anyone not obeying the law of God could be punished with any of the following EXCEPT (Ezra 7:26)?
Why did Ezra say the king was so favorable to him (Ezra 7:28)?
choice: The hand of the Lord his God was on him
The Lord has visited his people
The king had turned to the ways of the Lord

question: The descendants of Phinehas and Gershom returned from Babylon during the reign of what Persian king (Ezra 8:1f)?
Where did Ezra and his people assemble and camp for three days (Ezra 8:15)?
choice: The canal that flows toward Ahava
By the well outside the city of Haran

question: When the people assembled at the canal what did Ezra not find present (Ezra 8:15)?
Who were Joiarib and Elnathan known for whom Ezra summoned (Ezra 8:16)?
When Ezra found out there were no Levites he summoned all of the following leaders EXCEPT (Ezra 8:16)
Who was the leader of the temple servants in Casiphia (Ezra 8:17)?
Why did Ezra send to Iddo in Casiphia (Ezra 8:17)?
choice: So that they might take up an offering for Ezra’s journey to Jerusalem
So that they might bring attendants for the house of God
So that they might purify themselves to minister at the temple
So that he might pray for their journey

question: Who did Iddo send to go with Ezra from the Levites who was known to be a capable man (Ezra 8:18)?
Hashabiah and Jeshaiah were the descendants of what clan of Levites (Ezra 8:19)?
Who set up the temple servants to assist the Levites (Ezra 8:20)?
What was true of all the 220 temple servants who accompanied Sherebiah (Ezra 8:20)?
choice: They were all priests of the Most High God
They were all registered by name
They all came with gifts of gold and silver

question: Where did Ezra proclaim a fast (Ezra 8:21)?
What did Ezra proclaim by the Ahava Canal (Ezra 8:21)?
choice: Summoned the gathering of all Israel

question: Why did Ezra call for a fast by the Ahava Canal (Ezra 8:21)?
choice: So they might ask God for a safe journey
So that they might be released from their oppressors
So that they might worship God freely in Susa
So that they might find favor with King Artaxerxes

question: Of what was Ezra shamed to do (Ezra 8:22)?
choice: To ask the king for gold and silver for the temple
To leave Persia and return to Israel
To ask the king for soldiers to protect them
To take with them all that they had acquired in Persia

question: What had Ezra told the king of Persia (Ezra 8:22)?
choice: God would protect those who turn to him from all harm
There is no God but our God and Yahweh is his name
The Lord will not abandon his children wherever they go
The gracious hand of our God is on everyone who looks to him

question: Who did Ezra tell the king the anger of the Lord would be against (Ezra 8:22)?
choice: Those who do what is evil and unjust
Those who harm the people of God

question: To whom by name did Ezra weigh out the offerings of silver and gold (Ezra 8:24)?
What did Ezra do to the 12 leading priests along with Sherebiah (Ezra 8:24)?
choice: He sprinkled water on their heads
He promised them and their children homes in Israel

question: All of the following were listed as having donated articles of gold and silver to those returning with Ezra EXCEPT (Ezra 8:25)
choice: The keepers of the royal treasury

question: How many articles of silver and talents of gold did Ezra weigh out as donated to the house of God (Ezra 8:26)?
Why had the king and his officials donated gold and silver to Ezra (Ezra 8:26)?
choice: To give to the poor in Jerusalem
For the palace of the governor

question: What did Ezra consecrate to the Lord after receiving the gifts from the king of Persia (Ezra 8:28)?
choice: The bulls and rams for sacrifice in the house of God
The articles and the priests and Levites
The pilgrims who were making the journey
The King of Persia and his advisers

question: What did Ezra call the gold and silver that was donated (Ezra 8:28)?
choice: A generous gift to the most High
A tribute paid to God of heaven

question: Who received the gold and silver to be taken to the house of God in Jerusalem (Ezra 8:30)?
From where did Ezra set out for Jerusalem (Ezra 8:31)?
What does Ezra attribute the protection he received from his enemies on the journey to Jerusalem (Ezra 8:31)?
choice: The hand of our God was upon us
God is a mighty warrior fighting for Israel
God is our savior and help in times of trouble

question: When Ezra arrived in Jerusalem for how many days did he rest after arriving (Ezra 8:32)?
What was done on the fourth day after Ezra arrived in Jerusalem (Ezra 8:33)?
choice: The weighed out the silver and gold into the hands of the priests
They started rebuilding the house of God
They ordered that all the people be assembled and they read the Law of Moses
They presented themselves to the governor Tattenai

question: Who was the main priest to whom Ezra presented the sacred articles after arriving in Jerusalem (Ezra 8:33)?
All of the following received the sacred articles from Ezra when he arrived at Jerusalem EXCEPT (Ezra 8:33)
How was the gold, silver and sacred articles accounted for after Ezra arrived at Jerusalem (Ezra 8:34)?
choice: By the recorder who counted it all
By the high priest who weighed it
By Ezra who presented each article

question: The exiles who had returned offered what two types of sacrifices to the Lord (Ezra 8:35)?
What was offered by the exiles who had returned with Ezra for a sin offering (Ezra 8:35)?
How many bulls were offered as a burnt offering by the exile who returned with Ezra (Ezra 8:35)?
To whom did Ezra deliver the king’s orders after returning to Jerusalem (Ezra 8:36)?
What did the royal satraps and governors of Trans-Euphrates do for exiles (Ezra 8:36)?
choice: They turned over their authority to Ezra the scribe of God
They gave assistance to the people and to the house of God
They carried out the king’s orders
They fought against the enemies of Israel

question: What region was Jerusalem considered to be part of by the Persian governors and satraps (Ezra 8:36)?
Besides the people who were explicitly identified as not keeping themselves separate from the neighboring peoples (Ezra 9:1)?
Why were the people to keep separate from the neighboring peoples (Ezra 9:1)?
choice: Because they had rejected the Lord
Because they had aided the Babylonians when Jerusalem was destroyed

question: Ezra 9:1 lists all of the following groups as participating in detestable practices EXCEPT
When Ezra said the people had not kept themselves separate what specifically was he addressing (Ezra 9:2)?
choice: Intermarriage with the people around them
Doing violence and injustice against the poor

question: How did Ezra identify the exiles in comparison with the neighboring peoples like the Hittites (Ezra 9:2)?
choice: Those who are of the circumcision

question: Who two groups led the Jews into intermarriage with the neighboring peoples (Ezra 9:2)?
When Ezra heard of the problem of intermarriage all of the following were his responses EXCEPT (Ezra 9:3)
choice: Threw dust and ashes on his head

question: Who gathered around Ezra when he sat appalled at the exiles unfaithfulness (Ezra 9:4)?
choice: Those who trembled at the words of God
Those who followed the ways of the Lord
Those who worshipped the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob

question: Why did those who trembled at the words of God gather around Ezra (Ezra 9:4)?
choice: Because Israel had offered sacrifices to Baal
Because the priests had served other gods
Because of the unfaithfulness of the exiles
Because of the enemies of the Lord were triumphing over Israel

question: How long did Ezra sit appalled after being told of the exiles unfaithfulness (Ezra 9:4)?
How did Ezra pray to the Lord (Ezra 9:5)?
choice: On his knees with his hands spread out
Standing before the altar of the Lord
With his face in the dust before the Lord

question: When did Ezra pray to God because of the exiles unfaithfulness, sin and guilt (Ezra 9:5)?
choice: As the people gathered for Passover
During the reading of the Law

question: What did Ezra in his prayer say had reached to the heavens (Ezra 9:6)?
How high did Ezra portray the exiles’ sins in his prayer to God (Ezra 9:6)?
What was Ezra not able to do in his prayer of confession because of the exiles’ sins (Ezra 9:6)?
How long does Ezra in his prayer of confession link their current sins (Ezra 9:7)?
choice: From when Israel stood before the Lord at Mount Sinai
From the days of our forefathers
From the crossing of the Red Sea
From the days of Cain and Abel

question: Who did Ezra list as having been subject to the sword and captivity (Ezra 9:7)?
Who did Ezra in his prayer of confession identify as the ones subjecting the exiles to captivity and humiliation (Ezra 9:7)?
Ezra in his prayer of confession says Israel had been subjected to all of the following by foreign kings EXCEPT (Ezra 9:7)
In Ezra’s prayer of confession what does he cite as an indication of God’s graciousness (Ezra 9:8)?
choice: God led them through the desert
God provided manna as food from heaven
God did not deal with them as their sin deserved

question: Where had God given the exiles a firm place (Ezra 9:8)?
choice: In the land of their forefathers

question: In Ezra’s prayer of confession what did he say God had given them (Ezra 9:8)?
In his prayer of confession how did Ezra identify the exiles whom God had not deserted (Ezra 9:9)?
Through whom does Ezra say in his prayer of confession had God shown his kindness through (Ezra 9:9)?
In Ezra’s prayer of confession what did he say God had given them (Ezra 9:9)?
choice: A wall of protection in Jerusalem

question: In Ezra’s prayer of confession for what purpose does he say God had granted them new life (Ezra 9:9)?
choice: To build the walls of Jerusalem
To rebuild the house of God
To restore the altar of the Lord
To offer sacrifices to the God of Jacob

question: In Ezra’s prayer of confession what does he say the exiles have disregarded (Ezra 9:10)?
Through whom does Ezra say God gave his commandments (Ezra 9:11)?
choice: Through the kings of Israel and Judah
Through men of God who spoke to Israel

question: Who did Ezra say were God’s servants (Ezra 9:11)?
What had the people of the land done to the land (Ezra 9:11)?
How did the people of the land pollute the land (Ezra 9:11)?
choice: By violating the widows and orphans
By their rejection of the God of Israel

question: With what had the inhabitants of the land filled the land from one end to the other (Ezra 9:11)?
What had the servants the prophets commanded the Israelites not to do in the land they were entering to possess in Ezra’s prayer of confession (Ezra 9:12)?
choice: Not give their children in marriage to the inhabitants of the land
Not to multiply horses and chariots
Not to turn from following the Lord their God

question: What would did Ezra say that they should leave to their children as an everlasting inheritance (Ezra 9:12)?
What were the exiles not to seek from the people of the land (Ezra 9:12)?
In Ezra’s prayer of confess what did he say the remnant was a sign of (Ezra 9:13)?
choice: God was long suffering and slow to anger
God had punished them less than they deserved
God had promised the throne to David and his descendants forever

question: In Ezra’s prayer of confession what did he fear the intermarriage would result in (Ezra 9:14)?
choice: No survivor or remnant would be left
Their children would be sent back into exile
Famine and plague would strike them down

question: In Ezra’s prayer what did he say God in his righteousness had done (Ezra 9:15)?
As a result of their guilt what were the exiles not able to do (Ezra 9:15)?
choice: To escape the judgment of God

question: What did Ezra do while he was praying and confessing before the house of God (Ezra 10:1)?
What were the Israelites around Ezra doing while he was praying and confessing (Ezra 10:1)?
Who confessed that they had been unfaithful to God by marrying foreign women (Ezra 10:2)?
What did Shecaniah say to Ezra (Ezra 10:2)?
choice: They had broken the covenant by eating with unwashed hands
They had been unfaithful by marrying foreign women

question: What did Shecaniah propose to Ezra should be done in the matter of foreign wives (Ezra 10:3)?
choice: To request that all the foreign women vow allegiance to the Lord
To destroy all the foreign idols brought into Israel by the foreign wives
To send the women and their children away
To leave with their wives and return to the home of their wives

question: Shecaniah encouraged Ezra to make a ________ and send the foreign wives and children away (Ezra 10:3)?
What did Ezra have all the priests and Levites and all Israel do according to the word of Shecaniah (Ezra 10:5)?
choice: Take an oath about sending the foreign wives and children away
Pray to the Lord for forgiveness
Offer a sacrifice for the sins of Israel

question: Who was specifically listed besides all Israel took the oath to do what Shecaniah had suggested about sending the foreign wives and children away (Ezra 10:5)?
choice: The prophets and servants of the Lord
The leaders and elders of Israel

question: Where did Ezra go to fast and drink no water (Ezra 10:6)?
choice: The room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib

question: Why did Ezra go to the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib (Ezra 10:6)?
choice: To eat and drink with the priests and Levites of Israel
To pray to the Lord his God
To mourn over the unfaithfulness of the exiles

question: What did Ezra do in the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib (Ezra 10:6)?
choice: He ate no food and drank no water
He offered a sacrifice to the Lord
He tore his clothes and pulled out his hair
He lead the elders of Israel in a prayer of confession

question: What proclamation was issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem (Ezra 10:7)?
choice: That the exiles return to the land of their families
That the exiles assemble in Jerusalem
That the exiles bring sacrifices to the Lord in Jerusalem for their sins
That the exiles weep and fast for seven days

question: How many days did the proclamation give for all the exiles to assemble in Jerusalem (Ezra 10:8)?
What would happen to anyone who did not assemble in Jerusalem in three days according to the proclamation (Ezra 10:8)?
choice: They would be forced to return to Babylon
They would be captured and brought by force
They would have to offer a bull and a lamb as a sacrifice
They would forfeit all their property

question: What would happen to anyone who did not assemble in Jerusalem in three days according to the proclamation (Ezra 10:8)?
choice: They would be forced to return to Babylon
They would be captured and brought by force
They would be expelled from the assembly of the exiles
They would have to offer a bull and a lamb as a sacrifice

question: Besides Judah what other tribe assembled in Jerusalem according to the proclamation (Ezra 10:9)?
Besides the occasion, why were the people assembled in Jerusalem distressed (Ezra 10:9)?
choice: Because of the heat of the sun

question: When were the people assembled in Jerusalem distressed over the rain (Ezra 10:9)?
Who announced that the exiles must separate from their foreign wives to the people assembled (Ezra 10:11)?
What role did Ezra play in Israel (Ezra 10:11)?
What did Ezra tell the exiles assembled in Jerusalem they must do after their unfaithfulness (Ezra 10:11)?
choice: Keep the law of the Lord

question: Why did the assembled people say they could not stand outside (Ezra 10:13)?
choice: Because it was the rainy season
Because the sun was so hot
Because they had not eaten in a week

question: How did the whole assembly respond to Ezra after he told them to separate from their foreign wives (Ezra 10:12)?
choice: They rebelled and returned to their homes

question: All of the following opposed Ezra’s “solution” of separating from their foreign wives EXCEPT (Ezra 10:15)
Who actually implemented Ezra’s resolution concerning those who had married foreign women (Ezra 10:16)?
choice: One head from each family division
One judge from each city in Israel
One priest from each administrative district

question: What did they do on the first day of the tenth month (Ezra 10:16)?
choice: They sent all the foreign women away
They began to investigate the cases of the foreign wives
They confessed their sins before the Lord

question: Who was listed at the end of the book of Ezra (Ezra 10:18ff)?
choice: Those who refused to separate from their foreign wives
The heads of families who had to investigate the issue of the foreign women
The leaders of Israel whom Ezra appointed as judges over Israel
The priests who had married foreign women

question: What did the priests do who had married foreign women (Ezra 10:19)?
choice: Offered a ram as a guilt offering
Confessed their sins before the people
Fasted and wept for seven days
Sprinkled oil on the heads of the women who had to leave

question: What two roles of the Levites were cited in the list of those who had taken foreign wives (Ezra 10:24)?
